Faults.message: We’re very sorry for the power cut today. Storm Ciaran is bringing strong winds and heavy rain to the south coast and that is causing damage to our network and an increase in power cuts. We will be dispatching engineers as soon as it’s safe to do so. In the meantime, our control centre is working hard to remotely try and get power back on for as many customers as possible. You can keep track of the latest updates here on Power Track and we’ll also text you with updates if you’ve chosen to receive these. If you have any questions, our team is on hand 24 hours a day to help, so feel free to send us a message below or call us on 105.
Faults.name: GU28 Area

Faults.name: BH15 Area

Faults.message: We're sorry for the loss of supply. The reason you're currently without power is a planned outage in the areas listed. We have turned off your electricity supply to allow us to safely carry out essential work to our electrical equipment. By doing this, it'll help us to improve the reliability of our service to you for the future. If you have any questions or require more information, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook or Twitter (@ssencommunity) with reference '219714'. You will have received a letter from us confirming your power will be interrupted with specific information relating to your property. If you did not receive this letter, you can assume your power will not be interrupted.
